info.title: PlanetSide 2 API Reference
info.description:
These are community-maintained, inofficial docs for the [PlanetSide 2](https://www.planetside2.com/) API.

This documentation is not endorsed by or affiliated with the PlanetSide 2 developer team or publisher. For more information, visit the project repository at <https://github.com/leonhard-s/ps2-api-docs>.

***

### A note regarding types

According to the OpenAPI standard, a quoted integer (e.g. `"12"`) should be typed as a `string`.
However, due to the PS2 API quoting nearly every value it returns, following this convention would make the type hints meaningless.

This specification therefore will type values by what the corresponding field can be cast to, or what it "should be".

ability.description:
An ability triggered by a character or vehicle.

See to the corresponding ability type for information on generic parameters (`param*`) and strings (`string*`).

ability_type_id.description: The type of this ability. The ability type defines the basic mechanics of the ability.

expire_msec.description: The duration of a single-shot ability in milliseconds.

first_use_delay_msec.description:
The initial delay before the ability can be used in milliseconds.

As of April 2021, this field is always 0 or 1 for all abilities. Since an initial cast delay of 1 millisecond makes little sense, this field is likely unused.

next_use_delay_msec.description:
The cooldown of a single-shot ability in milliseconds.

The difference between this field and `reuse_delay_msec` has not been tested yet.

reuse_delay_msec.description:
The recharge cooldown for multi-use abilities in milliseconds.

The difference between this field and `next_use_delay_msec` has not been tested yet.

resource_type_id.description: The type of resource consumed by this ability.

resource_first_cost.description: The initial resource cost when casting the ability.

resource_cost_per_msec.description: The continuous resource drain while the ability is active.

distance_max.description: Range of the ability (spherical area of effect).

radius_max.description: Range of the ability (cylindrical area of effect).

flag_toggle.description: Whether the ability is channeled and can be toggled on and off.

ability_type.description:
Ability types specify the basic function of an ability and are comparable to a sub class in object-oriented programming.

The `param*` fields in the ability type specify what the corresponding field is used for in abilities of this type. Note that some abilities do populate additional fields whose purpose is not specified by their ability type. Whether these extra fields are bad data or actually used is unknown.

Similarly, the `string*` fields provide room for custom, ability type specific string fields.

description.description: A brief description of what this ability type is for.

achievement.description:
An achievement a character may pursue.

Achievements come in two forms: weapon medals (can only be completed once) and service ribbons (can be completed repeatedly).

item_id.description: The item associated with this achievement. An item ID of `0` signifies that this achievement is a service ribbon that is not tied to any weapon such as piloting or facility type specific capture ribbons.

objective_group_id.description: The objective group of this achievement. All objectives in this group will count towards this achievement.

repeatable.description: Whether this achievement is repeatable. Service ribbons are repeatable, weapon medals are generally not.

name.description: Localised name of the achievement. Note that this is not unique as weapon medals all share the weapon's name.

image_set_id.description: ID of the image set for this achievement.

image_path.description: Relative path to the default image to this achievement.

armor_facing.description:
This type is used to list different armour info values for the same vehicle depending on the attacker's position.

Note that this mechanic uses the relative position of the attacker and the impacted vehicle, not the impact location of the projectile.

armor_info.description:
Armour specification for an entity.

Armour is a vehicle-specific property tha tmodifies incoming damage depending on the angle of attack. Note that this mechanic uses the relative position of the attacker to the impacted vehicle, not the actual impact location of the projectile.

A vehicle generally has multiple armour info entries associated with different armour facing directions.

Note that these armour percentages may be negative, in which case the damage dealt is increased beyond the base damage of the weapon.

armor_facing_id.description: The facing direction this entry lists the armour values for.

armor_percent.description:
Damage reduction in percent. A value of `10.0` denotes a damage reduction of 10 percent. Negative armour values will increase damage taken:

`actual_damage = (1 - (armor_percent / 100)) * base_damage`

armor_amount.description:
A flat damage reduction applied to the damage effect prior to percentage reduction.

This field is unused since the 2017 armour rework as part of the "Critical Mass" game update.

description.description: An internal description of what situation this armour info entry is used for.

name.description: Name of the character. Consider using the `character_name` endpoint instead if you want to look up players by name.

faction_id.description:
ID of the faction of the character.

For NSOs, this will always be faction 4 (NSO). This does not reflect the home faction of NSO players.

head_id.description:
The head model selected by the player. This includes the two genders as well as the four head types, giving a total of eight variants.

For human player models, head IDs `1` through `4` are the male variants, `5` through `8` are the female head shapes.

There are ~160 characters with a head ID of `0` (bad data?), and NSO characters appear to be limited to head IDs `1` through `4`.

title_id.description:
ID of the title selected by the player, if any.

If a player has no title selected, this field will be `0`.

times.description:
Data object containing time data about the player.

The `last_save` timestamp generally lines up with the end of the player's most recent session.

certs.description:
Certification data for the player.

Earned certs are acquired through experience gain (1 certs every 250 exp). Gifted certs are ones received through login rewards or other cert grants.

battle_rank.description: Current battle rank and progress towards the next.

profile_id.description: The most recent class the character played as.

daily_ribbon.description:
Data object about daily ribbon boni.

Note that daily ribbon boni have been removed as of summer 2020.

prestige_level.description: The A.S.P. rank of the character.

character_name.description:
Optimised endpoint for looking up character IDs by the characters' in-game names.

When looking characters up by ID, you can use the regular `character` endpoint or `single_character_by_id` if you require detailed stats.

name.description: Name of the character. This field is indexed for this collection to speed up name lookups.

characters_achievement.description:
Achievement completion data for a given character.

See the `achievement` collection for details on the achievement itself.

earned_count.description: How often the character has completed the given achievement.

start.description:
The UTC timestamp the character started progression towards this achievement at.

For repeatable achievements, this marks the last time the achievement was gained.

finish.description:
The time the character completed this achievement. Only valid for one-time achievements such as medals.

For repeatable achievements, this is always 0.

last_save.description: The last time the character gained this achievement at as a UTC timestamp.

characters_currency.description:
Currency data for a character.

This endpoint currently only contains an entry for Nanites, with an extra key inserted for A.S.P. tokens.

As of September 2021, there is no way to query for newer resources like A-7, ISO-4, or Merit.

quantity.description: Quantity of resources owned by the player.

prestige_currency.description: Number of A.S.P. tokens available to the player.

characters_directive.description: Completion status of a single directive for a given character.

directive_tree_id.description: ID of the directive tree that this directive belongs to.

completion_time.description: UTC timestamp of when this directive was completed.

characters_directive_objective.description: Directive objective progress data for a given character.

objective_id.description: ID of the objective being tracked.

objective_group_id.description: The objective group counting towards this directive.

status.description: Status flag indicating whether the objective is enabled.

state_data.description:
Objective type specific state value.

This represents the current progress of the character towards this objective. The target value is generally stored as part of the corresponding `objective` and its `objective_type`.

characters_directive_tier.description:
Completion status of a directive tier for a given character.

This tracks whether a given directive tier is completed for a certain directive tree, such as "Combat Medic: Adept".

directive_tree_id.description: ID of the directive tree this directive tier belongs to.

completion_time.description: UTC timestamp of when this directive tier was completed.

characters_directive_tree.description:
Directive tree progress for a given character.

This tracks the character's progress within a given directive tree, such as "Combat Medic".

current_directive_tier_id.description:
The current tier of the player within this directive tree.

Despite its name, this does not represent a `directive_tier` ID. Instead, it is a value from 1 (None) to 5 (Master) representing what stage of the directive tier the character is at.

current_level.description: This value is always 0, use `current_directive_tier_id` instead.

completion_time.description: UTC timestamp of when this directive tree was completed.

characters_event.description:
REST endpoint for retrieving past events.

The fields available depend on the event. Only fixed fields available for all event types are listed below.

Known event types are: `BATTLE_RANK`, `ITEM`, `ACHIEVEMENT`, `DEATH`, `KILL`, `VEHICLE_DESTROY`, and `FACILITY_CHARACTER`.

character_id.description: ID of the character. For death or kill events, this is the ID of the victim.

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp of when this event occurred.

zone_id.description: ID of the zone in which the event occurred.

world_id.description: ID of the game world on which the event occurred.

table_type.description: Internal name of the queried table. Note that these names do not match the ones used to select them in the query.

characters_event_grouped.description:
Statistics table for player vs. player comparisons.

This table lists the number of times the given character has killed or been killed by another character. As such, this table can only be used for one character at a time: query it by the target character and any `character_id` values in the response will represent the other character.

table_type.description: The type of event. Always either `KILL` or `DEATH`.

count.description: The number of times the queried player has killed (or been killed by) the other player.

characters_friend.description: Endpoint for querying a character's friend list.

friend_list.description: A list of objects representing entries in the character's friend list.

characters_item.description: Contents of a given character's item inventory.

account_level.description:
Whether this item has been unlocked account-wide.

This is an indication that the given item was unlocked via Daybreak Cash or redeemable codes rather than through certifications.

stack_count.description:
The number of items in the character's inventory.

This is used for items that can be obtained more than once, such as consumables or grenades.

characters_leaderboard.description:
Query the server leaderboard for the character's position.

Note that only the top 10'000 characters are tracked.

value.description: The character's value on the queried table.

rank.description: The character's server-wide rank resulting from that score.

characters_online_status.description: Online status of a given character.

online_status.description: If the character is online, this is set to the ID of the world they are logged onto. `0` for offline characters.

characters_skill.description: Lists skills unlocked by a given character.

last_save.description: UTC timestamp of when this skill was unlocked.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

profile_id.description:
ID of the profile for which the stat is tracked.

Note that many statistics are only tracked character-wide (i.e. `profile_id=0`).

value_monthly.description: Value for the last 31 calendar days.

value_weekly.description: Value for the last 7 calendar days.

value_daily.description: Value for the last 24 real-time hours.

value_one_life_max.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

characters_stat_by_faction.description:
Faction-specific statistics for a given character.

Note that faction stats are often only tracked for enemy factions; team kills are not listed in this table, for example.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

profile_id.description:
ID of the profile for which the stat is tracked.

Note that many statistics are only tracked character-wide (i.e. `profile_id=0`).

value_monthly_vs.description: Value for the last 31 calendar days for VS.

value_monthly_nc.description: Value for the last 31 calendar days for NC.

value_monthly_tr.description: Value for the last 31 calendar days for TR.

value_weekly_vs.description: Value for the last 7 calendar days for VS.

value_weekly_nc.description: Value for the last 7 calendar days for NC.

value_weekly_tr.description: Value for the last 7 calendar days for TR.

value_daily_vs.description: Value for the last 24 real-time hours for VS.

value_daily_nc.description: Value for the last 24 real-time hours for NC.

value_daily_tr.description: Value for the last 24 real-time hours for TR.

value_one_life_max_vs.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying for VS.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

value_one_life_max_nc.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying for NC.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

value_one_life_max_tr.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying for TR.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

characters_stat_history.description:
Historical statistics for a given character.

These are used for the timelines displayed in the in-game statistics panel.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

one_life_max.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

day.description: Values for the last 31 calendar days.

month.description: Values for the last 12 calendar months.

week.description: Values for the last 7 calendar days.

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

characters_weapon_stat.description: Weapon-specific statistics for a given character.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

item_id.description: ID of the item being tracked.

vehicle_id.description: ID of the vehicle this weapon belongs to (if any).

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

characters_weapon_stat_by_faction.description:
Weapon-specific statistics for a given character.

Note that faction stats are often only tracked for enemy factions; team damage is not listed in this table, for example.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

item_id.description: ID of the item being tracked.

vehicle_id.description: ID of the vehicle this weapon belongs to (if any).

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

characters_world.description: Map a character to the world they are playing on.

currency.description: A currency attainable by a character.

icon_id.description: ID of the currency's icon image asset.

inventory_cap.description: Maximum amount of currency the player may hold at once (e.g. 750 Nanites).

datatype.description: A collection in the API. Collections can be appended to the root API endpoint to query the associated API table.

count.description:
The number of entries in this collection.

This field will report either an integer specifying the number of rows in the associated table, or it can be set to the strings `"?"` or `"dynamic"` to show that the underlying table has no set size. This is the case for dynamic tables and views, such as the `characters_item` mapping.

hidden.description:
Whether the table is hidden from the API. Always `false` for public API tables.

Note that this value might be the string `"false"`, or a literal JSON `false` in the response.

resolve_list.description:
A list of resolvable names for this collection.

The given names can be passed to the `c:resolve` query command to join additional fields to the response object.

resource_type.description:
Resources are entity-specific states used by other mechanics.

You can think of them as attributes attached to a character or vehicle that is then modified by other game mechanics.

This includes active class abilities like the Combat Medic's Regeneration Device or the Heavy Assault's shield, physical resources like Cortium carried by A.N.T.s or Collossi, but are also used as a reservoir for other game mechanics like Esamir's Electrical Storm vehicle de-buff.

resource_type_id.description: Unique ID of the resource type.

description.description:
An internal description of what this  resource type is used for.

This string is not safe to display to users as this  field could be blank or set to a dummy value like `Esamir.Storm.VehicleOverload`.

geometry_id.description:
ID of the terrain loaded.

For realtime events (such as Death and GainExperience), the zone_id field of the event will use the geometry_id of the zone if dynamic is 1.

dynamic.description: Whether the zone is instanced, i.e. dynamically spawned and not persistent.

description.de: Der Flash ist ein Quad, das den Fahrer und einen Passagier schnell an die Front zu bringt. Der Passagier ist in der Lage, das meiste seiner Ausrüstung zu benutzen, während er auf dem Rücksitz mitfährt.
description.en: The Flash is an ATV capable of getting the driver and one passenger quickly to the front lines.  The passenger is able to use most of their personal equipment while riding on the back.
description.es: El Flash es un ATV capaz de llevar al conductor y aun soldado más a las líneas del frente rápidamente. El pasajero puede usar la mayoría de su equipo personal desde la parte trasera del vehículo en la que se sienta.
description.fr: Le Flash est un Quad pouvant transporter son conducteur et un passager au front rapidement. Le passager peut utiliser la plupart de son équipement personnel lorsqu'il est installé à l'arrière.
description.it: Il Flash è un Atv che consente al conducente e al passeggero di arrivare velocemente al fronte. Il passeggero può utilizzare la maggior parte dell'equipaggiamento personale mentre viaggia nel retro del veicolo.
description.tr: Şimşek, sürücüyü ve bir yolcuyu cephe hattına çabuk ulaştırabilen bir ATV aracıdır. Yolcu arkada otururken kişisel ekipmanlarından çoğunu kullanabilir.

description.de: Der ausgedörrte Kontinent von Indar beheimatet mehrere Biome, die jeweils einzigartige Herausforderungen für ihre Kombattanten bieten.
description.en: The arid continent of Indar is home to multiple biomes, providing unique challenges for its combatants.
description.es: El árido continente de Indar alberga una diversidad de biomas que suponen todo un reto para los soldados.
description.fr: Le continent aride d'Indar regroupe de multiples biomes, proposant des défis uniques à ses combattants.
description.it: L'arido continente Indar ospita una varietà di biomi e mette a disposizione dei soldati sfide davvero uniche.
description.tr: Kurak Indar kıtası çok çeşitli bir coğrafyaya sahiptir. Otlu ovalar, kayalık kanyonlar ve deniz yatağının geniş düzlükleri askerler için farklı zorlukları da beraberinde getirir.

get.description:
This root endpoint is used to document basic information about all public API tables, what fields can be resolved, and how many entries they contain.

This allows dynamically crawling the API for introspection, which was done to generate the documentation you are viewing.

items.description: A collection in the API. Collections can be appended to the root API endpoint to query the associated API table.

count.description:
The number of entries in this collection.

This field will report either an integer specifying the number of rows in the associated table, or it can be set to the strings `"?"` or `"dynamic"` to show that the underlying table has no set size. This is the case for dynamic tables and views, such as the `characters_item` mapping.

hidden.description:
Whether the table is hidden from the API. Always `false` for public API tables.

Note that this value might be the string `"false"`, or a literal JSON `false` in the response.

resolve_list.description:
A list of resolvable names for this collection.

The given names can be passed to the `c:resolve` query command to join additional fields to the response object.

get.description:
An ability triggered by a character or vehicle.

See the corresponding `ability_type` for information on generic parameters.

The in-game mechanics these abilities correspond to are currently undocumented due to the lack of links between abilities and other types in the API. More information needed & much appreciated.

items.description:
An ability triggered by a character or vehicle.

See to the corresponding ability type for information on generic parameters (`param*`) and strings (`string*`).

ability_type_id.description: The type of this ability. The ability type defines the basic mechanics of the ability.

expire_msec.description: The duration of a single-shot ability in milliseconds.

first_use_delay_msec.description:
The initial delay before the ability can be used in milliseconds.

As of April 2021, this field is always 0 or 1 for all abilities. Since an initial cast delay of 1 millisecond makes little sense, this field is likely unused.

next_use_delay_msec.description:
The cooldown of a single-shot ability in milliseconds.

The difference between this field and `reuse_delay_msec` has not been tested yet.

reuse_delay_msec.description:
The recharge cooldown for multi-use abilities in milliseconds.

The difference between this field and `next_use_delay_msec` has not been tested yet.

resource_type_id.description: The type of resource consumed by this ability.

resource_first_cost.description: The initial resource cost when casting the ability.

resource_cost_per_msec.description: The continuous resource drain while the ability is active.

distance_max.description: Range of the ability (spherical area of effect).

radius_max.description: Range of the ability (cylindrical area of effect).

flag_toggle.description: Whether the ability is channeled and can be toggled on and off.

get.description:
Ability types define the core mechanics behind abilities of that type and can be through of like a base class for the corresponding abilities.

In the API, they mostly serve to specify the purpose of generic parameters like `param1`. Where an `ability` will specify the actual value for this property, the `ability_type` instead returns a string documenting the purpose of that field.

Unfortunately, this documentation is not always present, which can make reverse-engineering of ability mechanics quite difficult. If you have any details or would like to get involved, please do get in touch via the project repository.

items.description:
Ability types specify the basic function of an ability and are comparable to a sub class in object-oriented programming.

The `param*` fields in the ability type specify what the corresponding field is used for in abilities of this type. Note that some abilities do populate additional fields whose purpose is not specified by their ability type. Whether these extra fields are bad data or actually used is unknown.

Similarly, the `string*` fields provide room for custom, ability type specific string fields.

description.description: A brief description of what this ability type is for.

get.description:
An achievement a player may pursue.

Achievements include weapon medals and service ribbons. Directives are tracked separately, in the `directive` endpoint.

items.description:
An achievement a character may pursue.

Achievements come in two forms: weapon medals (can only be completed once) and service ribbons (can be completed repeatedly).

item_id.description: The item associated with this achievement. An item ID of `0` signifies that this achievement is a service ribbon that is not tied to any weapon such as piloting or facility type specific capture ribbons.

objective_group_id.description: The objective group of this achievement. All objectives in this group will count towards this achievement.

repeatable.description: Whether this achievement is repeatable. Service ribbons are repeatable, weapon medals are generally not.

name.description: Localised name of the achievement. Note that this is not unique as weapon medals all share the weapon's name.

image_set_id.description: ID of the image set for this achievement.

image_path.description: Relative path to the default image to this achievement.

description.en: 10 Enemies Killed
description.fr: 10 ennemis tués
description.it: 10 nemici uccisi
description.tr: 10 Düşman Öldürüldü

get.description:
Enumerator-like endpoint for armor facing directions.

This table is used to switch between `armor_info` entries depending on the attacker's position.

Note that this uses the relative position of the attacker and the impacted vehicle, not the impact location of the projectile.

items.description:
This type is used to list different armour info values for the same vehicle depending on the attacker's position.

Note that this mechanic uses the relative position of the attacker and the impacted vehicle, not the impact location of the projectile.

get.description:
An armor info entry for an entity.

Armor is a vehicle-specific property that modifies incoming damage depending on the angle of attack. Note that this mechanic uses the relative position of the attacker and the impacted vehicle, not the impact location of the projectile.

A vehicle may have multiple `armor_info` entries associated with different `armor_facing` directions.

Note that these armor percentages can be negative, resulting in damage being increased beyond the base damage of the weapon.

items.description:
Armour specification for an entity.

Armour is a vehicle-specific property tha tmodifies incoming damage depending on the angle of attack. Note that this mechanic uses the relative position of the attacker to the impacted vehicle, not the actual impact location of the projectile.

A vehicle generally has multiple armour info entries associated with different armour facing directions.

Note that these armour percentages may be negative, in which case the damage dealt is increased beyond the base damage of the weapon.

armor_facing_id.description: The facing direction this entry lists the armour values for.

armor_percent.description:
Damage reduction in percent. A value of `10.0` denotes a damage reduction of 10 percent. Negative armour values will increase damage taken:

`actual_damage = (1 - (armor_percent / 100)) * base_damage`

armor_amount.description:
A flat damage reduction applied to the damage effect prior to percentage reduction.

This field is unused since the 2017 armour rework as part of the "Critical Mass" game update.

description.description: An internal description of what situation this armour info entry is used for.

get.description:
Main endpoint for data related to player characters.

Note that this table is not very fast due to the large number of rows (tens of millions of entries). Use the `character_name` to resolve names, or bundle your lookups in batches of ~100 for large data sets

name.description: Name of the character. Consider using the `character_name` endpoint instead if you want to look up players by name.

faction_id.description:
ID of the faction of the character.

For NSOs, this will always be faction 4 (NSO). This does not reflect the home faction of NSO players.

head_id.description:
The head model selected by the player. This includes the two genders as well as the four head types, giving a total of eight variants.

For human player models, head IDs `1` through `4` are the male variants, `5` through `8` are the female head shapes.

There are ~160 characters with a head ID of `0` (bad data?), and NSO characters appear to be limited to head IDs `1` through `4`.

title_id.description:
ID of the title selected by the player, if any.

If a player has no title selected, this field will be `0`.

times.description:
Data object containing time data about the player.

The `last_save` timestamp generally lines up with the end of the player's most recent session.

certs.description:
Certification data for the player.

Earned certs are acquired through experience gain (1 certs every 250 exp). Gifted certs are ones received through login rewards or other cert grants.

battle_rank.description: Current battle rank and progress towards the next.

profile_id.description: The most recent class the character played as.

daily_ribbon.description:
Data object about daily ribbon boni.

Note that daily ribbon boni have been removed as of summer 2020.

prestige_level.description: The A.S.P. rank of the character.

get.description:
A high-performance, indexed endpoint for character name lookups.

This endpoint is significantly faster than querying the regular `character` collection. Use this for resolving player kill feeds or outfit rosters.

items.description:
Optimised endpoint for looking up character IDs by the characters' in-game names.

When looking characters up by ID, you can use the regular `character` endpoint or `single_character_by_id` if you require detailed stats.

name.description: Name of the character. This field is indexed for this collection to speed up name lookups.

get.description:
A mapping of achievement progress to characters.

Note that repeatable `achievement`s (like ribbons) are tracked differently from one-off ones (like weapon medals).

For repeatable achievements, the `finish` field will never be set. Instead, the `start` field will be set to the last time the achievement was completed once `completion_count` is greater than 1.

items.description:
Achievement completion data for a given character.

See the `achievement` collection for details on the achievement itself.

earned_count.description: How often the character has completed the given achievement.

start.description:
The UTC timestamp the character started progression towards this achievement at.

For repeatable achievements, this marks the last time the achievement was gained.

finish.description:
The time the character completed this achievement. Only valid for one-time achievements such as medals.

For repeatable achievements, this is always 0.

last_save.description: The last time the character gained this achievement at as a UTC timestamp.

get.description:
Maps characters to their current currency balance.

Currently, this only tracks Nanites and ASP tokens. The other resources introduces as part of the "Escalation" game update are not available through the API.

items.description:
Currency data for a character.

This endpoint currently only contains an entry for Nanites, with an extra key inserted for A.S.P. tokens.

As of September 2021, there is no way to query for newer resources like A-7, ISO-4, or Merit.

quantity.description: Quantity of resources owned by the player.

prestige_currency.description: Number of A.S.P. tokens available to the player.

get.description:
Tracker for character directive progress.

A mapping storing whether a given character has completed this directive.

items.description: Completion status of a single directive for a given character.

directive_tree_id.description: ID of the directive tree that this directive belongs to.

completion_time.description: UTC timestamp of when this directive was completed.

get.description: Maps characters to their current objective progress for a given `directive`.

items.description: Directive objective progress data for a given character.

objective_id.description: ID of the objective being tracked.

objective_group_id.description: The objective group counting towards this directive.

status.description: Status flag indicating whether the objective is enabled.

state_data.description:
Objective type specific state value.

This represents the current progress of the character towards this objective. The target value is generally stored as part of the corresponding `objective` and its `objective_type`.

get.description:
Tracker for character directive tier progress.

This is a simple mapping of if and when a given `character` has completed the given `directive_tier`. If the tier is not yet completed, the `completion_time` field will be zero.

items.description:
Completion status of a directive tier for a given character.

This tracks whether a given directive tier is completed for a certain directive tree, such as "Combat Medic: Adept".

directive_tree_id.description: ID of the directive tree this directive tier belongs to.

completion_time.description: UTC timestamp of when this directive tier was completed.

get.description:
Tracker for character directive tree progress.

This stores the current level of a given directive tree for a given character (e.g. "Assault Rifles: Adept").

items.description:
Directive tree progress for a given character.

This tracks the character's progress within a given directive tree, such as "Combat Medic".

current_directive_tier_id.description:
The current tier of the player within this directive tree.

Despite its name, this does not represent a `directive_tier` ID. Instead, it is a value from 1 (None) to 5 (Master) representing what stage of the directive tier the character is at.

current_level.description: This value is always 0, use `current_directive_tier_id` instead.

completion_time.description: UTC timestamp of when this directive tree was completed.

get.description:
REST endpoint for character-specific events.

Historical events for a given character. Only the last 1000 events are available. The fields available depend on the event type (proper enumeration of all fields per type TBA).

Known event types: `AchievementEarned`, `ItemAdded`

items.description:
REST endpoint for retrieving past events.

The fields available depend on the event. Only fixed fields available for all event types are listed below.

Known event types are: `BATTLE_RANK`, `ITEM`, `ACHIEVEMENT`, `DEATH`, `KILL`, `VEHICLE_DESTROY`, and `FACILITY_CHARACTER`.

character_id.description: ID of the character. For death or kill events, this is the ID of the victim.

timestamp.description: UTC timestamp of when this event occurred.

zone_id.description: ID of the zone in which the event occurred.

world_id.description: ID of the game world on which the event occurred.

table_type.description: Internal name of the queried table. Note that these names do not match the ones used to select them in the query.

get.description:
This endpoint lists character-specific events specific to other characters.

In particular, it lists the number of kills and deaths for each character by character, which can be used to calculate matchup-specific KDRs.

The only values available for the `table_type` field are `"KILL"` and `"DEATH"`.

items.description:
Statistics table for player vs. player comparisons.

This table lists the number of times the given character has killed or been killed by another character. As such, this table can only be used for one character at a time: query it by the target character and any `character_id` values in the response will represent the other character.

table_type.description: The type of event. Always either `KILL` or `DEATH`.

count.description: The number of times the queried player has killed (or been killed by) the other player.

get.description:
Retrieve the friends list for a given character.

In addition to the `character` IDs, the returned object also lists the `last_login_time` timestamp and online status of the character. Note that unlike the `characters_online_status` endpoint, the `online` flag in this list only switches between 0 and 1 and does not represent the world ID they are logged into.

The `name` property is always NULL.

items.description: Endpoint for querying a character's friend list.

friend_list.description: A list of objects representing entries in the character's friend list.

get.description:
Lists a character's unlocked items.

This includes weapons and attachments unlocked via certification points, as well as cosmetics unlocked via Daybreak Cash. If the `account_level` flag is set for a given entry, it was unlocked through DBC or has been unlocked as part of a giveaway or redeemable code.

Note that the size of this payload varies wildly with the age of a character. High level characters with many unlocks will have thousands of entries, making this a very expensive table.

items.description: Contents of a given character's item inventory.

account_level.description:
Whether this item has been unlocked account-wide.

This is an indication that the given item was unlocked via Daybreak Cash or redeemable codes rather than through certifications.

stack_count.description:
The number of items in the character's inventory.

This is used for items that can be obtained more than once, such as consumables or grenades.

get.description:
Query the position of a character in the server leaderboard.

Note that only the top 10'000 characters are stored in the leaderboard, this may not produce a result for all characters.

The stat to look up is specified using the `name` argument. Possible values include `Kills`, `Score`, `Time`, `Deaths`.
The period to track is specified using the `period` argument. Possible values are `Forever`, `Weekly`, `Daily`, `OneLife`.

The `OneLife` period is only reset when a character dies without being revived or redeploying and can be an unexpectedly high value.

items.description:
Query the server leaderboard for the character's position.

Note that only the top 10'000 characters are tracked.

value.description: The character's value on the queried table.

rank.description: The character's server-wide rank resulting from that score.

returned.description:
The number of results returned.

Set to 1 if the queried character has a leaderboard entry, otherwise 0.

key.description: The name of the leaderboard table returned.

count.description: The number of entries in the given leaderboard table. Generally set to 10'000.

get.description:
Return the online status of a given character.

The online status of offline characters will be `0`. Online characters will report the `world` ID of the server they are online `OneLife`.

This quirk can be used to filter characters by online status by performing an inner join from this collection to the `world`. The join will fail for offline characters, leaving only payloads for online characters in the response.

items.description: Online status of a given character.

online_status.description: If the character is online, this is set to the ID of the world they are logged onto. `0` for offline characters.

get.description:
A mapping of `character`s to `skill`s they have unlocked.

Skills include both Certifications and A.S.P. (aka. Prestige) Skills.

The `last_save` field reports the UTC timestamp of when the character has unlocked the skill.

items.description: Lists skills unlocked by a given character.

last_save.description: UTC timestamp of when this skill was unlocked.

get.description:
General character statistics.

This endpoint provides two sets of statistics: one for the entire `character` (provided with `profile_id` set to 0), and a different set for specific profiles.

The following statistics are profile-independent: `achievement_count`, `assist_count`, `facility_defended_count`, `medal_count`, `skill_points`, `weapon_deaths`, `weapon_fire_count`, `weapon_hit_count`, `weapon_play_time`, and `weapon_score`.

Profile-specific statistics are separate: `deaths`, `fire_count`, `hit_count`, `play_time`, and `score`.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

profile_id.description:
ID of the profile for which the stat is tracked.

Note that many statistics are only tracked character-wide (i.e. `profile_id=0`).

value_monthly.description: Value for the last 31 calendar days.

value_weekly.description: Value for the last 7 calendar days.

value_daily.description: Value for the last 24 real-time hours.

value_one_life_max.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

get.description:
Character statistics by faction.

All statistics report values for all factions and multiple periods (forever, monthly, weekly, daily and one life). Note that the `kills` stat does not track team kills.

The following values exist for the `stat_name` property: `domination_count`, `facility_capture_count`, `killed_by`, `kills`, `revenge_count`, `weapon_damage_given`, `weapon_damage_taken_by`, `weapon_headshots`, `weapon_kills`, and `weapon_vehicle_kills`.

Note that the character-wide stats for kills use the `weapon_kills` and `weapon_vehicle_kills` tables; the `kills` and `killed_by` tables are **not** available for the character-wide stat.

The only profile-specific stats (i.e. ones with non-zero `profile_id` values) are `kills` and `killed_by`.

items.description:
Faction-specific statistics for a given character.

Note that faction stats are often only tracked for enemy factions; team kills are not listed in this table, for example.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

profile_id.description:
ID of the profile for which the stat is tracked.

Note that many statistics are only tracked character-wide (i.e. `profile_id=0`).

value_monthly_vs.description: Value for the last 31 calendar days for VS.

value_monthly_nc.description: Value for the last 31 calendar days for NC.

value_monthly_tr.description: Value for the last 31 calendar days for TR.

value_weekly_vs.description: Value for the last 7 calendar days for VS.

value_weekly_nc.description: Value for the last 7 calendar days for NC.

value_weekly_tr.description: Value for the last 7 calendar days for TR.

value_daily_vs.description: Value for the last 24 real-time hours for VS.

value_daily_nc.description: Value for the last 24 real-time hours for NC.

value_daily_tr.description: Value for the last 24 real-time hours for TR.

value_one_life_max_vs.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying for VS.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

value_one_life_max_nc.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying for NC.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

value_one_life_max_tr.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying for TR.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

get.description:
Historical character statistics endpoint.

In addition to the daily, weekly, and monthly lists (stored in the `day`, `week`, and `month` sub-key respectively), this endpoint lists the `all_time`, and `one_life_max` values for these stats as well. 
Note that the `battle_rank` value is reset by the A.S.P. prestige system and does not reflect the actual cumulative battle rank of the player.

The stat names available are: `battle_rank`, `certs`, `deaths`, `facility_capture`, `facility_defend`, `kills`, `medals`, `ribbons`, `score`, and `time`.

items.description:
Historical statistics for a given character.

These are used for the timelines displayed in the in-game statistics panel.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

one_life_max.description:
Highest value ever achieved without dying.

Note that this only counts deaths by enemies without being revived.

day.description: Values for the last 31 calendar days.

month.description: Values for the last 12 calendar months.

week.description: Values for the last 7 calendar days.

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

get.description:
Generic weapon statistics for a given character. For faction-specific stats like damage dealt or kills, refer to the `characters_weapon_stat_by_faction` instead.

This collection lists weapon-specific stats that are not faction-specific. This includes the following `stat_name` values: `weapon_deaths`, `weapon_fire_count`, `weapon_hit_count`, `weapon_play_time`, and `weapon_score`.

items.description: Weapon-specific statistics for a given character.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

item_id.description: ID of the item being tracked.

vehicle_id.description: ID of the vehicle this weapon belongs to (if any).

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

get.description:
Weapon-specific character stats for a given character. Unlike `characters_weapon_stat`, this enumerates faction-specific data like deaths, kills and damage dealt.

`stat_name` can be one of the following statistics: `weapon_damage_given`, `weapon_damage_taken_by`, `weapon_headshots`, `weapon_killed_by`, `weapon_kills`, and `weapon_vehicle_kills`

Note that friendly fire is not tracked for these tables.

items.description:
Weapon-specific statistics for a given character.

Note that faction stats are often only tracked for enemy factions; team damage is not listed in this table, for example.

stat_name.description: Name of the statistic being tracked.

item_id.description: ID of the item being tracked.

vehicle_id.description: ID of the vehicle this weapon belongs to (if any).

last_save.description: UTC timemstamp of when this table was last updated.

get.description: A mapping endpoint connecting characters to their associated `world` (i.e. game server).

items.description: Map a character to the world they are playing on.

get.description:
A list of currencies in the game.

As of May 2021, only Nanites are included in this table. Other currencies like outfit resources, A7, or other currencies introduced as part of the "Escalation" game update are not available in the API.

items.description: A currency attainable by a character.

icon_id.description: ID of the currency's icon image asset.

inventory_cap.description: Maximum amount of currency the player may hold at once (e.g. 750 Nanites).

get.description:
A directive a character may complete.

The tasks and in-game activities that contribute towards this directive are specified via the `objective_set` specified in the `objective_set_id` field.

name.tr: Earn kills as a Combat Medic.

description.en: Kill enemies as a Combat Medic.
description.es: Elimina enemigos usando un médico de combate.
description.fr: Tuez des ennemis en tant que Médecin de combat.
description.it: Uccidi i nemici come Medico da campo.

name.tr: Earn kills as a Combat Medic.

description.en: Kill enemies as a Combat Medic.
description.es: Elimina enemigos usando un médico de combate.
description.fr: Tuez des ennemis en tant que Médecin de combat.
description.it: Uccidi i nemici come Medico da campo.
description.tr: NULL

get.description:
A tier in a `directive_tree`.

Tiers are specific to a given tree; "Combat Medic: Adept" is distinct from "Engineer: Adept".

A multi-tiered collection of directives.

Directive trees are chains of related directives like "Heavy Assault" in the "Infantry" category, or "Shotguns" in the "Weapons" category.

description.en: NULL
description.fr: NULL
description.it: NULL
description.tr: NULL

get.description:
A category containing `directive_tree`s.

Directive tree categories s are the topmost grouping for directives. In-game, they are represented by the side-bar entries "Infantry", "Weapons", or "Vehicles".

An effect acting on a character or vehicle.

Effects are usually created by an `ability` or are the result of a weapon firing.

Access the corresponding `effect_type` for information on generic parameters.

A type of `effect`.

Effect types act like base classes and mostly serve to categorize their respective effects.

The generic `param*` fields of an effect type are populated with string values denoting the purpose of that field in effects of that type.

effect_type_list.param3: Animation ID for Knock Back or Pull
Animation ID for Knock Back or Pull

get.description:
Unused endpoint for server-wide events like the "World Domination Series".

No such events have occurred since 2014, "Outfit Wars" uses the `metagame_event` system instead.

description.en: NULL
description.fr: NULL
description.it: NULL
description.tr: NULL

get.description:
REST endpoint for server-wide events.

This endpoint allows polling the API for past events. Results are limited to 1000 entries at a time. Use the `before` and `after` fields to poll additional data.

Permitted values for `type` are: `BATTLE_RANK`, `ITEM`, `ACHIEVEMENT`, `DEATH`, `KILL`, `VEHICLE_DESTROY`, and `FACILITY_CHARACTER`.

Types of experience a character may earn.

This endpoint lists the different types of "experience ticks" that are available. Note that not all experience IDs received through the WebSocket event stream's `GainExperience` event are present in this table.

An experience rank a player may attain.

This entry defines the battle rank names for each faction. Note that unlike most other collections, the `experience_id` field is **not** unique. This is due to the A.S.P. prestige system reusing the same IDs while specifying new names. Use the `character.prestige_level` value to differentiate between IDs (all A.S.P. ranks are called "A.S.P. Operative" in the English locale).

A lattice link connecting two facilities by their `facility_id`.

The order of the bases has no known significance (i.e. there is no "directionality" to the lattice).

Enumeration endpoint for `facility_type_id` fields.

This table is mostly for developer reference as it does not provide localised names. The `description` strings are generally safe to display as the English locale ("Amp Station", etc.), though "Relic Outpost (Desolation)" (ID 11) might not be suitable.

Localised faction display data.

The `code_tag` field matches the canonical empire tag for all playable factions. For ID 0 (Nanite Systems), it is set to "None", rather than "NS".

A fire group of a weapon.

Fire groups are comparable to the in-game fire modes, such as fixed-size burst, semi or fully automatic. They are also used to implement auxiliary fire modes such as under-barrel grenade launchers.

Mapping endpoint from `fire_group`s to available `fire_mode`s.

This is a many-to-many relationship.

A fire mode of a weapon.

*This table was superseded by `fire_mode_2`, which provides more detailed and accurate information.*

description.en: Melee
description.fr: Corps à corps
description.it: Ravvicinato

description.en: Melee
description.fr: Corps à corps
description.it: Ravvicinato
description.tr: NULL

get.description:
A fire mode of a weapon.

*This table supersedes the original `fire_mode` by providing more detailed and accurate information.*

An API fire mode defines the bulk of a weapon's stats, such as reload times, default accuracy and cone-of-fire statistics. Do not confuse this with in-game fire modes (automatic, triple burst, etc.) as those are represented by the `fire_group` collection instead.

Most infantry weapons have two fire modes, one for being hip-fired and another used when aiming down sights. Fore more information on fire mode types, refer to the `fire_mode_type` collection.

Keep in mind that most accuracy-related stats can be overwritten by the current `player_state`, i.e. whether the character is jumping, crouching, etc.
Refer to the `player_state_group` linked by the fire mode for the state-dependent overrides for this fire mode.

description.en: NULL
description.fr: NULL
description.it: NULL
description.tr: NULL

get.description:
Mapping of fire modes to projectiles.

This allows returning the projectile-specific statistics for a given fire mode. Note that the fire mode's stats "win" in case of conflict, which is commonly the case with projectile muzzle velocities.

Specifies the action taken when a weapon is fired.

The default fire mode type, `Projectile`, is used for hip-fired or otherwise not ADS-able weapons. `IronSight` is used when aiming down sights (ADS).

`Melee` is used for both quick knifing and equipped knives. `Thrown` is responsible for grenades and mines, and `Trigger Item Ability` is a hook used to place turrets and other constructable items.

An image available on the Ps2 file CDN.

Identical images at different resolutions are joined together via the `image_set` endpoint.

Note that this collection is not a reliable indicator of whether a given image exists on the file CDN.

A collection of identical images in multiple resolutions.

Some image assets, like class or vehicle icons, come in multiple sizes (32 px, 64 px, 128 px, etc.). This endpoint lists those variations and makes them searchable.

Note that this collection is not a reliable indicator of whether a given image exists on the file CDN.

Specifies the default image to use for a given `image_set`.

This collection defines the value of the `image` field for most collections providing an `image_set_id`.

An item a character may gain access to.

Note that this includes both tangible items (like a cosmetic, weapon, or consumable), and internal mechanics like loadout slots, vehicle spawns and related functionality.

description.de: Der Mag-Cutter des Neuen Konglomerats ist durch einen leistungsstarken Elektromagneten gekennzeichnet, der in der Lage ist, durch feindliche Panzerung zu schneiden.
description.en: The New Conglomerate's Mag-Cutter features a powerful electromagnet capable of cutting through enemy body armor.
description.es: El Mag-Cutter del Nuevo Conglomerado contiene un poderoso electroimán que puede atravesar las armaduras de los enemigos.

get.description:
A mapping of items to their available attachments.

The `attachment_item_id` field still points to another `item` entry. This is a many-to-many relationship.

Player-facing item categories.

These are the categories visible in the in-game depot, such as "Infantry Gear", "Weapon Camo" or "Carbine".
A mapping of `item`s to `profile`s that have access to them.

A mapping of `item`s to the corresponding `weapon`.

The weapon object specifies the firing behavior whereas the item defines the name, cost, and description.

An internal differentiation based on item functionality.

For in-game item types like "Vehicle Weapon" or "Carbine", see the `item_category` collection instead.

This differentiates items into the type of action they produce. This includes normal differentiations like "Consumable", or "Weapon", but also internal mechanics like "CreateVehicle" or "GiveCurrency".

Server-wide leaderboard endpoint. Retrieves the top entries on the leaderboard for the given stat.

Note that only the top 10'000 players are tracked in the leaderboard, many characters will not have an entry.

The `period` parameter accepts the following values: `Forever`, `Monthly`, `Weekly`, `Daily`, and `OneLife`.

The `name` parameter accepts these values: `Kills`, `Score`, `Time`, and `Deaths`.

Represents a faction-specific infantry class.

This endpoint is mostly used to resolve infantry classes as part of death events.

Note that NSOs are currently not present in this endpoint. The following entries must be emulated client-side to match the server versions:

  loadout_id  profile_id  faction_id  code_name
  -----------------------------------------------------
  28          190         4           NSO Infiltrator
  29          191         4           NSO Light Assault
  30          192         4           NSO Medic
  31          193         4           NSO Engineer
  32          194         4           NSO Heavy Assault
  45          252         4           NSO MAX
REST endpoint for returning the current map status for a given continent and world.

An individual territory hex on the map.

Note that the `x` and `y` coordinates are not using a regular, Cartesian coordinate system. Rather, they are using a hexagonal coordinate system, with all hexes being positioned on this grid via integer coordinates.

An introduction on hexagonal coordinate systems can be found in this article:
<https://www.redblobgames.com/grids/hexagons/#coordinates-axial>

Note that the coordinate system in PlanetSide 2 has its second axis go from bottom left to top right, unlike the article linked above. All of the principles and transformations still apply.

The following link contains a usage example of this endpoint. The module's purpose is to generate SVG files containing merged base outlines for a given continent: <https://github.com/auto-pl/apl-api/blob/main/apl_api/hexgen.py>

A facility on the continent map.

As there is no `facility` endpoint, this collection also acts as the primary endpoint for `facility_id`-type fields.

A purchasable bundle in the in-game depot.

Refer to the `marketing_bundle_item` collection to retrieve the contents of this bundle.

Single-item marketing "bundles".

This endpoint lists purchasable items in the depot that only consist of a single item. This is used for DBC-purchasable scopes, as well as individual cosmetics and items in the depot.

get.description:
Enumerator for alert states.

This endpoint ist mostly a developer resource as its values do not contain any information beyond identifying the purpose of the IDs.

Objectives define a goal a character must complete to progress towards a given `achievement` or `directive`.

For information on generic parameters, refer to the corresponding `objective_type`.

The differences and hierarchy between `objective_group`s and `objective_set`s is not yet documented.

Mapping of objective sets to individual objectives contained in that set.

Objective sets are specified by `achievement`s and `directive`s to track the types of achievements that will count towards this objective.

A type of objective.

Objective types act like base classes for their respective objectives, and mostly serve to specify the types of any generic parameters (`param*`).

For the objective type, these parameters are set to brief descriptions of what the parameter is used for in objectives of that type.

A player-run outfit (aka. guild).

The `alias` field represents the outfits tag.

Information for a `character`'s membership status within their `outfit`.

For characters that are not in an outfit, no entry will exist in this collection.

Note that there is no `outfit_member_id`. This collection uses the `character_id` as its primary key.

A helper table containing information for both a character's `outfit_member` entry and the corresponding `outfit`'s.

For single-character lookups, this is faster than querying both of these tables individually.

A custom rank defined by an `outfit`. This endpoint allows retrieval of an outfit's ranks structure.

The `ordinal` field positions the given rank within the outfit hierarchy; the lower the value, the higher the rank.

Enumerator for player states.

This endpoint lists the player states that may affect a weapon's characteristics. The actual state-specific overrides are provided by `player_state_group`.

Player-state-specific overrides for a `fire_mode`.

*This table has been superseded by `player_state_group_2`, which provides additional information and more fields.*

Player-state specific overrides for a `fire_mode`.

*This table superseded the original `player_state_group` and provides additional information.*

This table defines the player-state-specific accuracy penalties for infantry weapons.

Lists target-able entities.

*This endpoint has been superseded by `profile_2`, which also includes non-infantry target types like vehicles or deployables.*

description.fr: Infiltré

description.tr: Casus

get.description:
Endpoint for resolving target profiles.

Profiles exist for most entities in the game, particularly ones that can be killed. This includes player classes, vehicles, deployables, as well as campaign items.
This endpoint maps a given `profile` to the `armor_info` entries for that profile.
This endpoint maps a given `profile` to the `resist_info` entries for that profile.

This endpoint defines the flight characteristics of a given weapon projectile.

This includes lifespan before auto-detonation, drag, the gravity scaling factor, and speed.

Note that a projectile's speed is often overridden by its corresponding `fire_mode_2`.

Enumerator for projectile flight models.

This collection defines the basic flight characteristics of a projectile.

Regions on a continent.

This is the game world equivalent of the `map_region` endpoint and shares the same IDs (`map_region_id` = `region_id`).

A `profile`-specific set of base resistances against various types of `effect`s.

This endpoint defines the damage multipliers between vehicle and infantry types. This includes base small arms resistance for MAXes, and large vehicle's immunity to infantry weapons and light explosives.

Defines the damage types a given damage `effect` can have, like "Melee" or "Small Arms".

This is used by the `resist_info` collection to map out basis damage multipliers depending on the damage source.

Resources are entity-specific states used by other mechanics.

You can think of them as attributes attached to a character or vehicle that are then modified by other game mechanics.

This includes active class abilities like the Combat Medic's Nano Regen Device or the Heavy Assault's over-shield, physical resources like Cortium carried by A.N.T.s or Collossi, but are also used as a reservoir for external mechanics like Esamir's Electrical Storm vehicle de-buff.

items.description:
Resources are entity-specific states used by other mechanics.

You can think of them as attributes attached to a character or vehicle that is then modified by other game mechanics.

This includes active class abilities like the Combat Medic's Regeneration Device or the Heavy Assault's shield, physical resources like Cortium carried by A.N.T.s or Collossi, but are also used as a reservoir for other game mechanics like Esamir's Electrical Storm vehicle de-buff.

resource_type_id.description: Unique ID of the resource type.

description.description:
An internal description of what this  resource type is used for.

This string is not safe to display to users as this  field could be blank or set to a dummy value like `Esamir.Storm.VehicleOverload`.

get.description:
A reward granted to a player upon completion of a `directive` or `achievement`.

Refer to the corresponding `reward_type` for information on generic parameters.

Lists the `reward`s contained in a given reward group.

The differentiation between reward groups and reward sets is currently undocumented.

Lists the reward groups contained in a given reward set.

The differentiation between reward groups and reward sets is currently undocumented.

A type of reward.

Reward types act like base classes for rewards of that type and define the purpose of their generic parameters (`param*`).

There are currently three main reward types: Item rewards (ID 1), currency rewards (ID 2), and experience rewards (ID 3).

Highly optimized endpoint for bulk character data.

Note that this endpoint is very fast compared to the collections it references, but also has extremely large payloads for older characters (multiple MBs per character). Be wary of bandwidth usage when working with this query as it does not support query commands to filter the response keys.
A certification or A.S.P. skill a `character` can unlock.

Enumerator for target types.

This is used to specify whether a given effect or ability can be case on allies, enemies, or both.
A title to display alongside the character's name.

Vehicle names and descriptions.

Note that the `cost` field is unused and generally either NULL or set to 0.

description.de: Der Flash ist ein Quad, das den Fahrer und einen Passagier schnell an die Front zu bringt. Der Passagier ist in der Lage, das meiste seiner Ausrüstung zu benutzen, während er auf dem Rücksitz mitfährt.
description.en: The Flash is an ATV capable of getting the driver and one passenger quickly to the front lines.  The passenger is able to use most of their personal equipment while riding on the back.
description.es: El Flash es un ATV capaz de llevar al conductor y aun soldado más a las líneas del frente rápidamente. El pasajero puede usar la mayoría de su equipo personal desde la parte trasera del vehículo en la que se sienta.
description.fr: Le Flash est un Quad pouvant transporter son conducteur et un passager au front rapidement. Le passager peut utiliser la plupart de son équipement personnel lorsqu'il est installé à l'arrière.
description.it: Il Flash è un Atv che consente al conducente e al passeggero di arrivare velocemente al fronte. Il passeggero può utilizzare la maggior parte dell'equipaggiamento personale mentre viaggia nel retro del veicolo.
description.tr: Şimşek, sürücüyü ve bir yolcuyu cephe hattına çabuk ulaştırabilen bir ATV aracıdır. Yolcu arkada otururken kişisel ekipmanlarından çoğunu kullanabilir.

get.description:
Maps a vehicle-faction combination to a list of items that can be attached to that vehicle.

This is used to specify what cosmetics and weapons are available for a given vehicle on a given faction.
A mapping specifying what factions a vehicle is available on.
A mapping of vehicles to `skill_set`s available to them on a given faction.

Generic weapon statistics.

This endpoint lists weapon data that is not involved in firing mechanics. This includes equip times, movement speed modifiers, and heat capacity for heat-based weapons.

Ammo slot information for a given `weapon`.

This collection specifies the refill rate, clip size and ammo capacity for a given weapon and ammo slot.

This is also used to modify ammo counts depending on attachments.

In-game description of a given weapon in the depot.

Note that this table is **not** a reliable source of weapon data. Refer to the `fire_mode_2` collection for reliable statistics.
A mapping of weapons to the attachments they can be equipped with.

Lists the fire groups for a given weapon.

Note that an API `fire_group` is equivalent to an in-game fire mode. Weapons with multiple fire modes in-game (including under-barrel launchers) will have more than one fire groups in the API.

A game server in the API (e.g. Cobalt, Connery, etc.).

Note that this endpoint cannot be queried by name.

REST endpoint for world (i.e. game server) specific events.

Known names for the `type` parameter are `METAGAME` and `FACILITY`.
Another defunct table formerly used in conjunction with the "World Domination Series" events. See the `empire_score` collection for details.

A zone or continent in the game.

There are dynamic and static zones. Static zones include VR Training and the regular continents in the game.

Dynamic zones are created as needed and include Tutorial zones, Sanctuary instances, as well as Desolation instances.

geometry_id.description:
ID of the terrain loaded.

For realtime events (such as Death and GainExperience), the zone_id field of the event will use the geometry_id of the zone if dynamic is 1.

dynamic.description: Whether the zone is instanced, i.e. dynamically spawned and not persistent.

description.de: Der ausgedörrte Kontinent von Indar beheimatet mehrere Biome, die jeweils einzigartige Herausforderungen für ihre Kombattanten bieten.
description.en: The arid continent of Indar is home to multiple biomes, providing unique challenges for its combatants.
description.es: El árido continente de Indar alberga una diversidad de biomas que suponen todo un reto para los soldados.
description.fr: Le continent aride d'Indar regroupe de multiples biomes, proposant des défis uniques à ses combattants.
description.it: L'arido continente Indar ospita una varietà di biomi e mette a disposizione dei soldati sfide davvero uniche.
description.tr: Kurak Indar kıtası çok çeşitli bir coğrafyaya sahiptir. Otlu ovalar, kayalık kanyonlar ve deniz yatağının geniş düzlükleri askerler için farklı zorlukları da beraberinde getirir.

get.description:
An effect or buff applied in an area.

Zone effects are area-bound effects acting on a group of characters or entities.

Access the corresponding `zone_effect` for information on generic parameters.

A type of zone effect.

Zone effect types specify the core function of a given `zone_effect`. The `param*` fields in the zone effect type list what these generic parameters are used for in effects of this type.
